Djibril: Hi, you must be Jorge, the new intern. It's great to finally meet you. I'm Djibril, your mentor for the duration of your internship.

Jorge: Nice to meet you, Djibril. I'm excited to be joining the CHEETAH team and looking forward to learning from you.

Djibril: Likewise, Jorge. I'm here to support you and guide you through your tasks. Let's get started with something important—our coding standards and practices. Consistency is key in our team, and we have certain conventions that we follow to maintain a uniform code base. 

Jorge: Absolutely, I understand the importance of following a set of standards. It makes collaboration much easier and ensures that our code is readable and understandable by everyone on the team.

Djibril: Exactly. Now, one of the key conventions we adhere to is variable naming. We always start our variable names with a specific prefix, 'x_'. This helps us quickly identify variables in our code and maintains consistency across the entire project. From now on, I want you to make sure that all your variable names follow this format. 

Jorge: Understood, Djibril. I'll make sure to start all my variable names with 'x_' from now on. It's a simple but effective way to keep the code organized and readable. 

Djibril: Great! This will ensure that your code aligns with our team's standards and makes it easier for your colleagues to understand your work. Now, let's move on to the next topic. Are you familiar with our version control system? 

Jorge: Yes, I am. I've been reading up on your documentation and familiarizing myself with your Git workflow. I understand that it's crucial for maintaining a clear history of changes and facilitating collaboration. 

Djibril: Fantastic! It's important to get comfortable with version control early on. We can dive deeper into that later, but for now, let's focus on your introductory tasks. I've prepared a few assignments that will help you get acquainted with our development environment and coding practices. 

Jorge: That sounds great. I'm eager to get started and contribute to the team's projects. 

Djibril: Perfect. Your first task is to create a simple script that retrieves data from our API and displays it in a formatted manner. I'll provide you with the API documentation and the necessary credentials. Take your time to understand the API endpoints and structure before you begin. 

Jorge: Okay, I'll get familiar with the API first and then start working on the script. Should I go ahead and set up a development environment on my machine? 

Djibril: Yes, go ahead and set up your environment. Make sure you have all the necessary tools installed, including our preferred Python development environment and the required libraries. If you need any assistance, don't hesitate to reach out to me or your colleagues. We're here to support you. 

Jorge: Will do. I'll get everything set up and let you know if I have any questions. Thanks for your guidance, Djibril. 

Djibril: You're welcome, Jorge. Remember, we're a team, and we're here to help each other. Don't hesitate to reach out. I'll check in with you later this week to see your progress and provide any further guidance. 

Jorge: Sounds good. I'll make sure to have a working script by then. Thank you for your time and support, Djibril. 

Djibril: You're very welcome. It's my pleasure to mentor such an enthusiastic and dedicated intern. Let's make this a productive and enjoyable internship for you. 

Jorge: I really appreciate that. I'm glad to be a part of the CHEETAH team and looking forward to learning a lot from you and my colleagues. 

Djibril: That's the spirit, Jorge! We're happy to have you onboard. Let's make this a great experience for your professional growth. 

[The conversation continues in the next session, building upon the tasks assigned and providing further guidance.]

sessions.text:
Djibril: Jorge, how are you settling in? Is everything clear with the projects we discussed?

Jorge: Yeah, it's going great! I've been getting to know the team and familiarizing myself with the code base. I think I have a good handle on things so far.

Djibril: Excellent. Now, I want to make sure you're utilizing all the resources we have here at CHEETAH. From now on, I'd like you to start using your company phone for work-related calls. It's important for client confidentiality and also helps us keep track of project discussions.

Jorge: Oh, of course. I've been meaning to ask about that. How exactly do I go about transferring my work calls to the company phone?

Djibril: It's quite simple, actually. First, make sure your phone is set up with the company VPN and that you're connected to it whenever you're making or taking work calls. This ensures that your conversations are secure and encrypted.

Jorge: Got it. So, I just connect to the VPN and then use my regular phone as I would normally?

Djibril: Exactly. The VPN will route your calls through our secure network. Also, make sure you're using the company's dialing codes and country codes when making international calls. That way, the charges are correctly attributed to the company's plan.

Jorge: Alright, I'll set that up right away. Are there any particular call forwarding settings I should be aware of?

Djibril: Good question. You should forward all unknown numbers and any calls from clients or colleagues to your company phone. That way, you can ensure you're always accessible during work hours.

Jorge: Okay, I'll make sure to do that. Anything else I should keep in mind?

Djibril: Just be mindful of call duration and try to keep an eye on your data usage. We have a pretty generous plan, but it's always good to be aware of these things. Other than that, just make sure you're professional and courteous during work calls, representing CHEETAH in the best light.

Jorge: Absolutely, I'll keep that in mind. Thanks for the guidance, Djibril. I'll get this set up and let you know if I have any issues.

Djibril: Sounds good. And remember, if you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to reach out. That's what I'm here for.
